intro: Operculina angustiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf operculina, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, white or violet flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a somewhat hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Operculina angustiloba is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid conditions.
